title: Rhaast seems to love his life while aatrox...
body:
Aatrox hates his life, his self and wants to die. I mean even at the end of his story it says that hopefully he'll find the means to end his life. 

Rhaast on the other hand just wants to go out and kill stuff. Idk if its because we havnt expanded on Rhaast's lore but while playing him it seems that he genuinely enjoys having a body again. But i know aatrox has been released way longer so maybe that has something to do with it?

replies.body:
I think you're on to something with the "genuinely enjoys having a body again" part. As far as we know, Kayn is Rhaast's first host. Even a degrading body that only sort of looks like Rhaast's original form has got to feel way better than being stuck as a mostly inanimate object.

So while Aatrox has had multiple hosts and plenty of time to realize their downsides, Rhaast *just* got some sort of mobile body back and he's too exuberant about that to really give it more thought.

> [{quoted}](name=NotaRobot1006,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=l9eQRxnr,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-06-29T16:29:47.087+0000)
>
> I think you're on to something with the "genuinely enjoys having a body again" part. As far as we know, Kayn is Rhaast's first host. Even a degrading body that only sort of looks like Rhaast's original form has got to feel way better than being stuck as a mostly inanimate object.
> 
> So while Aatrox has had multiple hosts and plenty of time to realize their downsides, Rhaast *just* got some sort of mobile body back and he's too exuberant about that to really give it more thought.

plus... kayn is a wayyy stronger host than aatrox's host.

> [{quoted}](name=BLACK REALM GOD,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=l9eQRxnr,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2018-06-29T16:31:15.441+0000)
>
> plus... kayn is a wayyy stronger host than aatrox's host.

definitely this. Rhaast can walk through walls and entire into peoples bodies and rip them apart. Aatrox has probably just been hosting random soldiers.

> [{quoted}](name=edgy aatrox main,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=l9eQRxnr,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2018-06-29T17:21:52.026+0000)
>
> definitely this. Rhaast can walk through walls and entire into peoples bodies and rip them apart. Aatrox has probably just been hosting random soldiers.

it actually says exactly that in aatrox's lore. he was picked up by a random soldier fleeing for his life.

> it actually says exactly that in aatrox's lore. he was picked up by a random soldier fleeing for his life.

In same source is also written:

> In the years that followed, Aatrox groomed many more hosts—men and women of exceptional vitality or fortitude.

Aatrox, also picks strong host whenever he has the possiblity.

In the end, Kayn's body will decay one day as well. No human body can't keep a Darkin's true form for forever.

> [{quoted}](name=Tialilia,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=l9eQRxnr,comment-id=00000000000000000000,timestamp=2018-06-29T18:12:18.785+0000)
>
> In same source is also written:
> 
> Aatrox, also picks strong host whenever he has the possiblity.
> 
> In the end, Kayn's body will decay one day as well. No human body can't keep a Darkin's true form for forever.

this is why i find it interesting that zed was searching for the weapons of the darkin... notice that is says "groomed"

wonder if there is a like a secret covenant that is dedicated to serving the darkin and is constantly being mentored and trained in order to one day wield the darkin weapons

Nop, Kayn was suppose to destroy the weapon, but he decided he knows that is the best for everyone.

> This hubris led Kayn to embrace his final test: to seek out a darkin weapon recently unearthed in Noxus, and prevent it from ever being used against the weary defenders of Ionia. He accepted without hesitation, never questioning why he had been chosen for this task. Indeed, where any other acolyte would have destroyed the living scythe known as Rhaast, Kayn took it for himself.

If you mean an order which grows meat puppet which a Darkin can takeover, honest, it would be possible. I remember someone posted the theory that all the Mt. Targon groups were created by the Aspect so they always have some willing hosts. Possible, however 2 weapons have been guarded/lost for a time (Varus & Rhaast).

I mean, I could imagine that maybe some smart Darkin creates a cult around him to have humans he can takeover, but I doubt Aatrox would. He doesn't search for a worthy host - he search for a way to end all things so he finally can die.

> [{quoted}](name=Tialilia,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=l9eQRxnr,comment-id=0000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2018-06-29T19:27:15.709+0000)
>
> Nop, Kayn was suppose to destroy the weapon, but he decided he knows that is the best for everyone.
> 
> If you mean an order which grows meat puppet which a Darkin can takeover, honest, it would be possible. I remember someone posted the theory that all the Mt. Targon groups were created by the Aspect so they always have some willing hosts. Possible, however 2 weapons have been guarded/lost for a time (Varus & Rhaast).
> 
> I mean, I could imagine that maybe some smart Darkin creates a cult around him to have humans he can takeover, but I doubt Aatrox would. He doesn't search for a worthy host - he search for a way to end all things so he finally can die.

It's occurred to me that Rhaast's 2 new sentences of backstory in Twilight of the Gods is the first time lore has referred to him as "he" instead of "it".

Progress!

(They do call Rhaast "he" in the ability descriptions, but not the bio or flavor stories proper until now)

Uffffff.

https://twitter.com/LaurieGoulding/status/1011309875626852353

But I agree, I want more Rhaast content. I want that Rhaast actually feels like a whole own person in the lore.
yea thats correct, aatrox hosts were extremely weak so he drained thined thier lives quickly and went back into the sword, whereas rhaast host is far stronger

It's also possible that Kayn (as a host) is not like other hosts.

Aatrox so far seems to have had only shit-tier hosts. Random battlefield warriors, literal nobodies, etc. It's not hard to think that maybe these hosts are not at all capable of containing the Darkin power and degrade.

However, Kayn is a shadow assassin who is possibly a being who can kill a darkin, if SA form is lore. This means that Kayn is IMMENSELY powerful and that Rhaast can take abilities Kayn had learned. It's not impossible to think that maybe in possessing Kayn, Rhaast has a long term or perhaps even permanent body because of how powerful Kayn is.

> [{quoted}](name=CaptainMårvelous,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=l9eQRxnr,comment-id=00000001,timestamp=2018-06-29T17:24:45.287+0000)
>
> It's also possible that Kayn (as a host) is not like other hosts.
> 
> Aatrox so far seems to have had only shit-tier hosts. Random battlefield warriors, literal nobodies, etc. It's not hard to think that maybe these hosts are not at all capable of containing the Darkin power and degrade.
> 
> However, Kayn is a shadow assassin who is possibly a being who can kill a darkin, if SA form is lore. This means that Kayn is IMMENSELY powerful and that Rhaast can take abilities Kayn had learned. It's not impossible to think that maybe in possessing Kayn, Rhaast has a long term or perhaps even permanent body because of how powerful Kayn is.

That would essentially mean that kayn what wield the power of an ascended as well. Is kayn op in lore?

I mean Kayn (in lore) is the prodigy of Shadow Assassination and on-par and perhaps even surpassing Zed in this mystic art. In addition, if the in-game is correct, Kayn has the physical and magical power to both suppress Darkin corruption _and kill a darkin_ if SA is canonical.

Kayn occupies a weird spot in the power curve where he could very well be obscenely powerful or maybe just a fluke for in-game purposes.

WAAARGHbobo says Kayn cannot kill Rhaast, he can just push him to dormant state until he dies. Which gives him the idea that he killed him, while he actually didn't but how could he know?

 When Kayn dies, Rhaast consumes his deceased body. But yeah, defeating him (aka pushing him to dormant state) is possible.

Darkins are currently near immortal champions. Their spirits are completely bound to their weapons. There isn't much thing to break this binding. You can't destroy a darkin, you just imprison them and don't give a fuck until death of the universe, which is far worse than death.

Thanks for the info, I didn't know this!

I'm also going to assume that Kayn isn't dead when Rhaast possesses him ("Kayn weeps in the abyss between worlds..._Idiot._") and just takes Rhaast's place in the weapon. 

But yeah, good point. From the sound of it Kayn is powerful enough to completely imprison a darkin so I'm going to assume Kayn's strength is pretty damn high.

This is actually stated in Aatrox' lore!

The hosts soul is pushed into the Darkins prison until their body dies.

As for actually killing a Darkin, we know a way, Illaoi could kill them via Test of Spirit.  But it would be a difficult battle, since its still a Darkin Soul.

He might have a smidgen of Vastayan blood in him, or perhaps be a genetic throwback to one. That could explain his magical prowess.

Honestly IMO the fact that Kayn was able to resist Rhaast taking over his body AT ALL is a sign of how strong he is. That's atypical for a Darkin weapon.

Aatrox? Instant. Varus? Instant.

It **could** implicate that Rhaast is just a weak Darkin but I doubt that's the case.
No kayn could not at all kill a darkin

It's probably because of Aatrox's pride

Rhaast is happy cause he finally got a body and is free to move on his own and all

While Aatrox wants his real body back, wants freedom, not these hosts that make a replica of his true and probably physically better self

Having a body is new and exciting for Rhaast. Aatrox was probably just as upbeat when he first found a mortal host... CENTURIES ago... :-P

It's like starting a new job - you're super excited and going above and beyond. Then compare to the guy who's been in the same job for 40 years, can't get promoted, blacklisted by every other company in town, etc etc.

It probably also helps that Aatrox has been searching and working to find an ideal body for centuries without much apparent success, while Rhaast's ideal body (stubbornness notwithstanding :p) basically came looking for him.

Rhaast DOES seem to have some small amount of respect for Kayn's abilities, especially his shadow magic.
Exactly this. :-)
(Also, Rhaast only gets a body if you, the player, choose that path for him in game. He hasn't done that in the lore, yet.)
Schrodinger's Kayn, if you will.

> [{quoted}](name=Scathlocke,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=l9eQRxnr,comment-id=000c0000,timestamp=2018-06-30T01:18:36.838+0000)
>
> (Also, Rhaast only gets a body if you, the player, choose that path for him in game. He hasn't done that in the lore, yet.)

YET. also first rioter on my post :D. Theoretically speaking if Kayn somehow beat rhaast would he hold the power of an ascended with no consequences?
Hmm, that kinda sheds an interesting new light on his overwhelming new power and the rather ornate appearance Rhaast's scythe takes in the Shadow Assassin route.

> [{quoted}](name=Raxistaicho,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=l9eQRxnr,comment-id=000c000000000000,timestamp=2018-06-30T02:22:56.999+0000)
>
> Hmm, that kinda sheds an interesting new light on his overwhelming new power and the rather ornate appearance Rhaast's scythe takes in the Shadow Assassin route.

its why shadow kayn 1 shots kids. Hes broken op lore wise

So basically Rhaast is the intern who is hyped as fuck to be working at Darkin Games while Aatrox is the 40-45 year old mid-level manager who has been through ten different kinds of hell and is absolutely fucking sick of his life?

Also: What bearing does Kayn being his host have on Rhaast? Does Kayn's body offer different things than any old foot soldier?
I think it's a fair assumption that Rhaast's ingame ability to assimilate Kayn's shadow magic is canonical, I don't see why it wouldn't be.

The issue with calling it "canonical" is that you then say the alternate choice is non-canonical. That would leave 50% of player choices invalid, by some people's absolute way of classifying it. Both outcomes are possible, but neither is (yet) canonical.

It's a what-if scenario, put in the hands of the player. :-)
So the Kayn/Rhaast conflict will never be canonically resolved?

I'm not sure I follow your line of thought, there. We have told (literally) no stories with Kayn since his release - this is not something we'd do lightly or quickly. Otherwise the champion in game would no longer reflect the canonical lore... Now THERE'S a Catch-22 situation! :-P

Kayn's principal conflict is almost not with Rhaast at all, but Zed. It is very likely that his master sent him to retrieve the weapon knowing that it would be the ultimate test for his protege - either it would destroy him, or he would conquer the Darkin and become a worthy new leader for the Order of Shadow.

Basically, Kayn and Zed have a super-complicated "adopted father" type of relationship going on. Rhaast is more like Lady Macbeth, in this current situation.

I understand there are other people involved in Kayn's path (though the Zed/Kayn dynamic needs some time in the spotlight if you really want people to consider that the primary conflict). I wasn't implying any "line of thought", just wondering if one would ever defeat the other. Aatrox overwhelmed his first host in seconds; how long could a battle for control last, even against a person of strong will?

I'm not sure why the story should be avoided just because of the "what-if?" stance change mechanic in-game.

Not avoided, just not really explored... _yet_... ;-)

It was just the progression to "this will never be covered" that I didn't quite understand. Seems we're on the same page, though!
Awesome, I'm a huge fan of Ionia and I'm really liking the new darkin stuff, so Kayn's story is one of the most interesting to me. Looking forward to stories of him.

Very unlikely, since a resolution would involve one of the two characters dying.

They're also more interesting playing off one another. Individually, Kayn and Rhaast are less interesting versions of Zed and Aatrox, but together they have a strange and unique relationship. So the loser dies, and the winner becomes boring.
Ah, my bad, I worded that a bit poorly. What I mean to say it's a good guess that Rhaast really WOULD be able to jack Kayn's shadow magic if he won :)

I always saw their relashionship as that first meeting where Rhaast and Kayn had the meeting of wills and they were equal, so while they are currently hooking up in the nice 1 room apartment Kayn I think Rhaast is just going full cat. Playing with his food and enjoying it before he utterly destroys it, and leaves it on the doorstep for you to find in the morning.

> [{quoted}](name=Scathlocke,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=l9eQRxnr,comment-id=000c,timestamp=2018-06-30T01:17:56.841+0000)
>
> Having a body is new and exciting for Rhaast. Aatrox was probably just as upbeat when he first found a mortal host... CENTURIES ago... :-P

Kinda explains how Rhaast goes from calculating to downright goofy when he wins :P
It's because Rhaast was based off of old lore while Aatrox is based off of new lore.

Actually not - Rhaast was created with the new Darkin lore already known, behind the scenes. :-)

The only champ that wasn't is Varus, hence the recent adjustment by Narrative to bring him in line properly.

> [{quoted}](name=Scathlocke,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=l9eQRxnr,comment-id=00050000,timestamp=2018-06-30T01:15:43.516+0000)
>
> Actually not - Rhaast was created with the new Darkin lore already known, behind the scenes. :-)
> 
> The only champ that wasn't is Varus, hence the recent adjustment by Narrative to bring him in line properly.

everytime you guys mention varus' update it sounds like a few rioters wanted to make a music video and went totally rogue on you all lmao

That's curious. If i remember correctly Varus' Lore got changed after Rhaast's (kayn's) release.
And I am not talking about his transformation but about the otherworldly Darkin. ([can be read on the wiki](https://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Varus#3rd))
If the Darkin lore was already known then why on earth did that story get released and retconned?

Aatrox roams "free" on Runeterra by far longer than Varus or Rhaast.
He knows that a human body can't keep the transformation forever, no matter what he does, he never reach his true form again.
Rhaast finally gets his first body - he still doesn't know the downside of this. He probably thinks if he kills enough, he can sustain himself forever. But that doesn't work like this.

> [{quoted}](name=Tialilia,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=l9eQRxnr,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2018-06-29T16:39:34.991+0000)
>
> Aatrox roams "free" on Runeterra by far longer than Varus or Rhaast.
> He knows that a human body can't keep the transformation forever, no matter what he does, he never reach his true form again.
> Rhaast finally gets his first body - he still doesn't know the downside of this. He probably thinks if he kills enough, he can sustain himself forever. But that doesn't work like this.

I think it is because Kayn is actually a powerful host as well. If Rhaast takes the body over he has control over someone who can sustain his form, he also gains Kayn's combat abilities as shown by his comments about shadow stepping. Aatrox has likely never had a truly powerful host, and he has never had a symbiotic relationship with his host like Rhaast or Varus. He never learned from them, just instantly dominated the frail body of random mooks.

Assuming thy started off human (which they did) and that they have 2 seperate personalities...

I'd say Rhaast either loves his life or is honestly just awaiting his chance.  He is most likely taking everything in stride.  You can tell how all of the other Ascended that were in attendance had differing mindsets.

But yeah. Rhaast most likely doesn't mind his new body since he just received it (or is trying to take hold of it)  Right now, he just finds the situation amusing if not a bit trivial.

Keeping in mind Rhaast's comments about Kayn's abilties ("Oh! I **do** like this~"), Kayn's body probably also suits him and **enhances** his power. Being a blood knight/battle nut probably also helps him stay positive lol.

Well they have two different personalities. 

Rhaast was probably one of those ascended, then darking, who truly reveled in war. In real life too, in times of war, there are those who see the conflict as a means to an end, and others who just "enjoy the moment"; aside from the majority who just wants it to end as soon as possible, of course. 

Also, Rhaast possibily had fewer hosts than Aatrox (I'm quite sure that it's stated that Kayn isn't really the first one to touch the scythe since forever). He's still in a phase where he can't yet see what sort of "life" he's going to face. 
Aatrox on the other hand has "seen it all". He's been stuck in this "grab host, decay, get locked, find another host" cycle for longer, and no longer wants to go through it. Also, he probably has a stronger sense of pride and dignity than Rhaast. 

Or maybe Rhaast wants to end it all, as much as Aatrox does, but has his own twisted sense of humor. Who knows.

"Ascended - Protectors of Shurima"

You read any of Rhaast quotes now knowing this, dude's insane. He was worthy enough to be given Ascension. How?

> [{quoted}](name=Jaspers,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=l9eQRxnr,comment-id=000b,timestamp=2018-06-29T23:10:29.175+0000)
>
> "Ascended - Protectors of Shurima"
> 
> You read any of Rhaast quotes now knowing this, dude's insane. He was worthy enough to be given Ascension. How?

My guess is that the insanity happened after Ascension, probably due to a combo of centuries of Void exposure followed by centuries of immobility and solitary confinement.
